intro.description: Decision Support This tutorial describes the basic steps for using the Decision Support feature of Bioclipse. For this tutorial it is good, but not necessary, to have Sample Data installed.

item.title: Step 1: Open the Decision Support Perspective
item.description:
The Decision Support Perspective is a setup of the workbench which is suitable for the Decision Support feature.
In the top menu, select option Window > Open Perspective > Other... and in the dialog select the Decision Support option.

item.title: Step 2: Open a chemical structure
item.description: In the Bioclipse Navigator, double-click a chemical structure to open it in the chemical editor. It is also possible to edit molecules.

item.title: Step 3: Run the Tests
item.description: The Tests can be run by right clicking in the Decision Support tab or by clicking the "Run all tests" button (with a 'play' icon) in the Decision Support View.

item.title: Step 4: Examine the Test results.
item.description: Each individual test can be examined by expanding it and selecting the results. If the test displays substructures, as for the Signature Significance, then the atoms that belongs to the substructure will be displayed in the chemical editor. Entire molecules will be displayed in the 2D viewer.

item.title: Step 5: Generate a report
item.description: By right clicking in the Decision Support tab it is possible to generate a Report. Note that it takes over 20 seconds to open the first report, while after this generating reports is much faster.

item.title: Step 6: Open an SDFile
item.description: In the Bioclipse Navigator, double-click an SDFile to open it in the MoleculesTable.

item.title: Step 7: Calculate all tests and consensus
item.description: Right-click in the MoleculesTable and select Decision Support > Consensus Classification

item.title: Step 8: Switch between tabs in the Molecules Table
item.description: Select one of the structures in the MoleculesTable and then click the tab Single molecule at the bottom of the editor. Here you can run individual tests, make changes to the molecule, and when you switch back to the tab Molecules the updated values are calculated in the background and the visualization is updated (just wait a few seconds for it to complete).

item.title: More information
item.description: This step concludes this tutorial. For more information, please refer to the Bioclipse Help system available from the top menu Help > Help Contents.
